docs.snippet: The editor of the German newspaper that broke the Panama Papers story said on Monday he did not know exactly where his team's source got the information but defended his decision to publish on the basis of the public interest.
docs.lead_paragraph: The editor of the German newspaper that broke the Panama Papers story said on Monday he did not know exactly where his team's source got the information but defended his decision to publish on the basis of the public interest.

headline.main: Editor in Panama Papers Says Published in the Public Interest
headline.print_headline: Editor in Panama Papers Says Published in the Public Interest

docs.snippet: Hopes the Italian government and top lenders will soon thrash out a plan for a state-backed fund to buy bad loans and plug capital shortfalls lifted banking shares on Monday, even though analysts warned the scheme would be no panacea.
docs.lead_paragraph: Hopes the Italian government and top lenders will soon thrash out a plan for a state-backed fund to buy bad loans and plug capital shortfalls lifted banking shares on Monday, even though analysts warned the scheme would be no panacea.

headline.main: Italian Banks Pin Hopes on State-Backed Rescue Fund
headline.print_headline: Italian Banks Pin Hopes on State-Backed Rescue Fund

docs.snippet: The commission tasked with protecting funds needed for closing down Germany's nuclear plants wants to decide on recommendations for the government at the end of April instead of this week, a commission source said.
docs.lead_paragraph: The commission tasked with protecting funds needed for closing down Germany's nuclear plants wants to decide on recommendations for the government at the end of April instead of this week, a commission source said.

headline.main: German Nuclear Commission to Decide on Recommendations at End of April-Source
headline.print_headline: German Nuclear Commission to Decide on Recommendations at End of April-Source

docs.snippet: Ukraine's likely new prime minister Volodymyr Groysman said on Monday that coalition members were assembling a reform-minded cabinet to root out corruption and cronyism, but it was not yet settled who would take the crucial post of finance minister.
docs.lead_paragraph: Ukraine's likely new prime minister Volodymyr Groysman said on Monday that coalition members were assembling a reform-minded cabinet to root out corruption and cronyism, but it was not yet settled who would take the crucial post of finance minister.

headline.main: Top Finance Job Still Unclear in New Ukraine Government
headline.print_headline: Top Finance Job Still Unclear in New Ukraine Government

docs.snippet: Investors are starting to look at Russia again after cutting off exposure amid geopolitical tensions two years ago, the head of Credit Suisse's $60 million Russian Equity Fund said.
docs.lead_paragraph: Investors are starting to look at Russia again after cutting off exposure amid geopolitical tensions two years ago, the head of Credit Suisse's $60 million Russian Equity Fund said.

headline.main: Investors Starting to Show Interest in Russia Again: Credit Suisse
headline.print_headline: Investors Starting to Show Interest in Russia Again: Credit Suisse

docs.snippet: The Bank of Italy said on Monday it is carrying out a routine inspection at the Italian offices of state-owned Bank of China.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Bank of Italy said on Monday it is carrying out a routine inspection at the Italian offices of state-owned Bank of China.

headline.main: Bank of Italy Says Carrying Out Inspection at Bank of China Offices
headline.print_headline: Bank of Italy Says Carrying Out Inspection at Bank of China Offices

docs.snippet: Volkswagen is hoping to return to the bond market as early as May, people familiar with the matter said, aiming to raise billions of euros to replace the costly bank loan it has been relying on in the wake of its emissions test cheating scandal.
docs.lead_paragraph: Volkswagen is hoping to return to the bond market as early as May, people familiar with the matter said, aiming to raise billions of euros to replace the costly bank loan it has been relying on in the wake of its emissions test cheating scandal.

headline.main: Volkswagen Aiming to Return to Debt Market as Early as May: Sources
headline.print_headline: Volkswagen Aiming to Return to Debt Market as Early as May: Sources

docs.snippet: Ukraine has become "very volatile" since Prime Minister Arseny Yatseniuk resigned, the head of the Council of Europe said on Monday, calling for the swift formation of a new government and  speedier progress on reforms.
docs.lead_paragraph: Ukraine has become "very volatile" since Prime Minister Arseny Yatseniuk resigned, the head of the Council of Europe said on Monday, calling for the swift formation of a new government and  speedier progress on reforms.

headline.main: Ukraine 'Very Volatile' After PM Resignation, Says Council of Europe
headline.print_headline: Ukraine 'Very Volatile' After PM Resignation, Says Council of Europe

docs.snippet: Defense Secretary Ash Carter gave an optimistic assessment Monday that the U.S military will be able to move ahead with agreements to cooperate more with India on aircraft carrier and other technology.
docs.lead_paragraph: Defense Secretary Ash Carter gave an optimistic assessment Monday that the U.S military will be able to move ahead with agreements to cooperate more with India on aircraft carrier and other technology.

headline.main: Carter Optimistic About More Military Cooperation With India
headline.print_headline: Carter Optimistic About More Military Cooperation With India

docs.snippet: Saudi Arabia is to provide Egypt with 700,000 tonnes of petroleum products a month under a $23 billion (16 billion pounds) deal over five years between Saudi Aramco and the Egyptian General Petroleum Corp, an EGPC official said on Monday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Saudi Arabia is to provide Egypt with 700,000 tonnes of petroleum products a month under a $23 billion (16 billion pounds) deal over five years between Saudi Aramco and the Egyptian General Petroleum Corp, an EGPC official said on Monday.

headline.main: Saudi Arabia to Supply Egypt With 700,000 Tonnes of Petroleum Products a Month
headline.print_headline: Saudi Arabia to Supply Egypt With 700,000 Tonnes of Petroleum Products a Month
